column4: Has anyone solved the screen tearing issues with nvidia proprietary drivers and dual monitors?
- have you set your v sync in compix config?
i set it in the nvidia config, and i enabled a workaround as suggested by some google results
- The nvidia config v sync doesnt seem to work
- install compiz settings manager if you haven't already
So where is the v sync option in compiz config
- uh I beleive general options, one sec
- http://tombuntu.com/index.php/2009/09/20/make-compiz-run-smoothly-and-without-tearing/ This should show you where that is located
- also you may have to disable v sync everywhere else you have turned it on (e.g. nvidia control panel)
my ccsm doesn't have the options mentioned in that link
- You probably installed the simple version.
- in Ubuntu Software center you can choose simple or advanced
- what version of ubuntu are you on?
- gotcha. I haven't used 11.10 yet, so I don't know if they changed something there
- I'm not sure what to tell you if that setting isn't there. Delete and reinstall compiz settings manager maybe?
- You could look into editing your xorg.conf to enter it manually. I wouldn't know how to help you with that though
- I'll be back in a bit sorry, but good luck
